Package it.polimi.ingsw.model.depots

Class Warehouse

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.depots.Warehouse
All Implemented Interfaces:
AcceptsSupplies, HasStatus
public class Warehouse extends Object implements AcceptsSupplies, HasStatus
A Warehouse contains 3 depots, which can contain respectively 1, 2 and 3 resources of one type. Two depots cannot contain the same type. User can add and remove resources from depots, can swap the order of 2 depots and can try to convert a marble to a resource and add it to one of the depots.

    • swapRows

      public void swapRows​(int r1, int r2) throws SupplyException
      Swaps the specified rows, if possible.
      Parameters:
      r1 - first row (1
      r2 - second row (1
      Throws:
      SupplyException - Swap isn't possible (one row has too many elements to fit the other row)

    • addMarble

      public void addMarble​(DepotID row, MarbleColor color, LeadersSpace leadersSpace) throws SupplyException, MarbleException
      Tries to convert the marble (from Marketplace or from the LeaderCard Market) to the specified row supply type, and, if possible, adds it to the row.
      Parameters:
      row - row to add the marble to
      color - color of the marble to add
      leadersSpace - where to look for white marble transformations
      Throws:
      SupplyException - Specified depot is full
      MarbleException - Marble cannot be converted to a compatible supply type

    • addSupply

      public void addSupply​(DepotID row, WarehouseObjectType wot, DepotID from) throws SupplyException
      Tries to add the specified resource to the specified row. Checks if the source of the resource is acceptable.
      Specified by:
      addSupply in interface AcceptsSupplies
      Parameters:
      row - row to add the resource to
      wot - type of resource
      from - source of the supply
      Throws:
      SupplyException - Row cannot accept the specified resource. Probably the row is full or accepts a different type, or there is another row with the same type.

    • removeSupply

      public void removeSupply​(DepotID row, WarehouseObjectType wot) throws SupplyException
      Removes the specified resource type from the warehouse.
      Specified by:
      removeSupply in interface AcceptsSupplies
      Parameters:
      wot - resource type to remove
      row - Storage to remove the supply from
      Throws:
      SupplyException - There isn't such resource

      public Pair<SupplyContainer,​SupplyContainer> clearSupplies()
      Removes all of the supplies.
      Specified by:
      clearSupplies in interface AcceptsSupplies
      Returns:
      A pair of SupplyContainer(s) containing the removed supplies. The first element contains supplies from the depots, the second one supplies from the strongbox.

    • allocate

      public void allocate​(SupplyContainer newSupplies)
      Adds the supplies in the container given as argument to the warehouse depots. In the process it is likely that the order of the depots will be modified.
      Parameters:
      newSupplies - SupplyContainer containing the resources to add to the warehouse
